This allows complex functions or modules to be invoked in a manner which is fairly transparent to the configuration file.

Fvwm looks for an fvwm command called "HelpMe", and fails. Next it looks for a user-defined complex function called "HelpMe". If no such function exists, fvwm tries to execute a module called "HelpMe".

section.title: Delayed Execution of Commands
section.para:
Note: There are many commands that affect look and feel of specific, some or all windows, like , , , and many others. For performance reasons such changes are not applied immediately but only when fvwm is idle, i.e. no user interaction or module input is pending. Specifically, new
options that are set in a function are not applied until after the function has completed. This can sometimes lead to unwanted effects.
To force that all pending changes are applied immediately, use the , or commands.
